title: Iraq Struggles to Contain Antigovernment Protests
text:
BAGHDAD—Iraq imposed a curfew in Baghdad and restricted access to the internet in a bid to quell the biggest antigovernment protests since Prime Minister Adel Abdul-Mahditook office a year ago.

Thousands of protesters have taken to the streets in the capital Baghdad and several cities in southern Iraq demanding jobs, improved quality of life and an end to corruption that plagues government services here. The protests have at times turned violent, with demonstrators torching government and political-party offices. Security...
description: Authorities imposed a curfew in Baghdad and restricted the internet after protests that left at least 17 people dead and up to 800 wounded.
